newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Aug 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Aug 29.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in two London-based Arabic-language newspapers on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Saudi Defence Minister Prince Sultan's visit to Yemen expected to have positive impact on economic links.
- Jordan to issue a new stock exchange law before the end of 1996.
- Arab countries need $200 billion to develop their oil production capacity.
- Tehran seeks to purchase long-range missiles. Iranian defence minister is expected to sign a new military agreement with China for weapons worth $4.5 billion.
- Iran plans to set up a new project in Syria to produce cars and engines.
